In my opinion, CS:GO is the best pure first person shooter. The movement, shooting, and utility mechanics are extremely nuanced, but the learning curve for each is steeper than your typical Call of Duty-style shooter. The game will frustrate you, but if you give it time to learn the ropes, you find out how engaging the game really is. 

Graphics are okay, nothing to write home about. 

The developers still regularly put out updates and seem to care about the game and its players. The community is a mixed bag of helpful/friendly teammates and toxic trolls, but Trust Factor has eliminated the latter half for me.

Fun game if you like FPS. You can choose a variety of weapons, grenades etc. There are also lots of different modes like gun game, battle royale if you're not a fan of just regular cs. With the competitive ranking system, it goes from silver to global. It's a lot more fun with friends.
